item.title: Is REPO Down on Steam? PC Server Status Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-repo-down-server-status-explained/

REPO is an online-only game, meaning the age-old issue of server issues comes up. Servers are a constant factor and it doesn’t matter if it’s a AAA title or a low-budget indie hit. If you’re experiencing connection issues with REPO’s server status, let’s see if there’s a reason why.

It’s incredible how a title can become a hit so quickly. REPO launched in February 2025 and amassed a healthy following of a few thousand players. This is a feat many indie developers would kill for. REPO cleared 100,000 concurrent players within two weeks, and its peak reached nearly 150K very quickly.

This is great news for developer semiwork, but it also places a lot of strain on the servers. If you’re being impeded by said servers, let’s try to clear up why it’s happening.

Are REPO Servers Down Right Now?

REPO is currently operational for many players right now.

As I write this, I’ve been on various Twitch channels, and streamers are broadcasting live gameplay from REPO. However, if you are having trouble, it might be connected to the North American servers.

User Pinny on the REPO Discord server had this to say about the server issues: “If you are getting large connection issues, please check for Steam client updates which should hopefully update Steam and help make playing with friends possible again make sure both you and your friends have done this!”

They continue to say you should “Try taking turns hosting between you and your group” as “NA servers are especially affected at the moment so if you have friends living elsewhere, try having them host!”

It’s not necessarily the overall servers then, but individual aspects of the connection. My advice would be to try Pinny’s recommendations and see if this alleviates any issues for you.

How to Check REPO Server Status

Joining the official REPO Discord server and checking socials and the website are the best ways to keep up with the latest server status developments.

You’ll find EA and Activision have dedicated websites showing live server reports. This isn’t as feasible for lesser-known companies, so I recommend safe sources related to the developer.

You can find each method below with accessible links:

  • REPO Discord Server
  • REPO X page
  • Semiwork website

If you need a break from REPO and want to see what else is in the pipeline, make sure to read about the biggest horror games coming in 2025.

REPO has the potential to outdo Lethal Company and many of its contemporaries. If you’ve played it, why do you think it’s taking off? Can it go one better and achieve Among Us levels of fame and fortune?

item.title: Asus Launching Monitors That Purify Air
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/asus-launching-monitors-that-purify-air/

Asus has announced its new lineup of monitors with a special ability to purify surrounding air. The lineup of new VU Air Ionizer monitors features three models: the 23.8-inch IPS panel Asus VU249HFI-W, the 27-inch IPS Asus VU279HFI-W, and the 34-inch VA Asus VU34WCIP-W.

These monitors feature a no-filter VU Air Ionizer that Asus says can “remove up to 90% of airborne dust in three hours” to remove various allergens and improve general indoor air quality.

PODCAST: The Future Of Call of Duty—Insider Gaming Weekly

“The ionizer has an effective coverage area of 1m³, purifying air throughout a workspace for comfortable productivity,” Asus said. “With no filters required, ASUS VU Air Ionizer series monitors seamlessly combine air purification and cutting-edge display technologies in one streamlined design.”

As far as specs are concerned, each monitor—no matter the size—has a 100Hz refresh rate with a 1ms response time. Both the 23.8- and 27-inch displays have an IPS (In-Plane Switching) panel with 178° viewing angles. The 34-inch monitor is a 21:9 ultrawide VA (Vertical Alignment) panel with the same 178° viewing angles. The two 16:9 displays have a brightness of 250 nits while the 21:9 Ultrawide has a brightness of 300 nits.

For pricing, the 23.8-inch starts at $129.99 while the 27-inch display will cost $159.99. If you decide you want the Ultrawide air purifier, it will cost $359.99.

What do you think of Asus’ gaming monitors that can purify the air? Let us know down below, and join the discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming Tech, check out our review of the MSI MPG Z890 Carbon WiFi motherboard. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

MSI MPG Z890 Carbon WiFi Review

The MSI MPG Z890 Carbon WiFi is a uppe-rmid to lower-premium level motherboard that has all the bells and whistles you’d need for your new PC.

Amid Reports Of Bricked RTX 5090 GPUs, Nvidia Is Investigating

After claims by users of their new Nvidia GeForce RTX 5090 GPUs being bricked, Nvidia has issued a small statement.

Intel Is Giving Away Civilization 7 And Assassin’s Creed Shadows With CPU Purchase

Intel has announced that players can get Assassin’s Creed Shadows and Civilization 7 for free with a new CPU purchase.

Nvidia RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 Launch To Be “Worst When It Comes To Availability”

According to multiple claims, the launch of the Nvidia RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 are expected to be the “worst” in terms of availability.
